snippet: Federal prosecutors trying to seize a 10th-century Cambodian statue from Sotheby’s have accused the auctioneers of colluding with the item’s owner to hide information that it was stolen.
abstract: Federal prosecutors trying to seize multimillion-dollar 10th-century Cambodian statue from Sotheby’s accuse auctioneers of colluding with item’s owner to hide information that it was stolen from a temple in 1972.

byline.original: By TOM MASHBERG and RALPH BLUMENTHAL

lead_paragraph: Federal prosecutors trying to seize a 10th-century Cambodian statue from Sotheby’s have accused the auctioneers of colluding with the item’s owner to hide information that it was stolen.

headline.main: Sotheby’s Accused of Deceit in Sale of Khmer Statue
headline.print_headline: Sotheby’s Accused Of Deceit in Sale Of Khmer Statue
